docs.lead_paragraph: Been waiting until the health-care debate entered the playoffs before you finally started to tune in? O.K., time to tune in.
docs.abstract: Time to pay attention to health care reform, as Democrats press ahead and Republicans dig in.
docs.snippet: Time to pay attention to health care reform, as Democrats press ahead and Republicans dig in.

docs.lead_paragraph: While President Obama was speaking in Wisconsin, senators were struggling to assemble health care legislation they hope to push through two committees this month.

headline.main: Co-op Health Plan Emerging as a Senate Option

docs.abstract: While President Obama was speaking in Wisconsin, senators were struggling to assemble health care legislation they hope to push through two committees this month.
docs.snippet: While President Obama was speaking in Wisconsin, senators were struggling to assemble health care legislation they hope to push through two committees this month.

docs.lead_paragraph: GREEN BAY, Wisc. -- President Obama strongly defended his idea for a government-sponsored health insurance plan at a town-hall meeting here today, saying "if the private insurance companies have to compete with a public option, it will keep them honest and it will keep -- help keep their prices down."

headline.main: Obama Defends Public Insurance Plan for Health Care

docs.abstract: The president asserts that having a public insurance option in overhauling health care will enhance competition with private companies, not hurt it.
docs.snippet: The president asserts that having a public insurance option in overhauling health care will enhance competition with private companies, not hurt it.

docs.lead_paragraph: GREEN BAY, Wisconsin -- There was a rare sight along the motorcade route as President Obama arrived here Thursday to talk about health care: a protest.

headline.main: Protesters Greet Obama in Green Bay

docs.abstract: The president traveled to Wisconsin for a town-hall meeting on health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: Monologue | Aired Wednesday night on NBC: Today, Chrysler was taken over by Fiat and the new C.E.O. said, this is a quote, "Going forward we intend to build on Chrysler's culture of innovation." Yeah. Yeah, then he laughed for three straight hours.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama begins another push for his health care agenda, taking his pitch on the road to a town-hall-style meeting in Green Bay, Wisc. later on Thursday.

headline.main: The Early Word: On the Road

docs.abstract: The president takes his health care agenda on the road, while the vice president takes the stimulus package literally to the roads and bridges.
